Search Palettes Dialog Box

Requires: Base Development System

Click the Search button on the toolbar of the Controls or Functions palette to display the Search Palettes dialog box.

Use this dialog box to perform text-based searches for any control, VI, or function on the Controls and Functions palettes.

This dialog box includes the following components:

  • Search—Contains the text LabVIEW uses to search for controls, VIs, and functions. Click the button again to hide the section of the dialog box where you can narrow or expand the search.
  • Functions—Displays only the objects on the Functions palette. LabVIEW displays the Functions page by default. When you click the Search button, LabVIEW searches all controls, VIs, and Functions.
  • Controls—Displays only the objects on the Controls palette. LabVIEW displays the Controls page by default. When you click the Search button, LabVIEW searches all controls, VIs, and Functions.
Note  You also can use the Quick Drop dialog box to specify an object by name and add the object to the block diagram or front panel.
